subject: Economics
title: The Tragedy of the Commons: Why Shared Things Get Destroyed
description: A quick win: understand The Tragedy of the Commons: Why Shared Things Get Destroyed.

hook.text: A shared office fridge is always disgusting. A shared printer always jams. Nobody takes care of what nobody owns.

buildup.text: The tragedy of the commons: when a resource is shared, each person has an incentive to use more and maintain less.

discovery.text: One extra cow on the common pasture benefits the farmer who adds it. But the cost â€” overgrazing â€” is shared by everyone.

twist.text: Ocean fishing follows this exactly. Each boat catches more, but the total fish population collapses.

climax.text: The tragedy of the commons explains pollution, overfishing, traffic congestion, and climate change.

punchline.text: If everyone owns it, nobody protects it.

quiz.question: What causes the tragedy of the commons?
options: Individuals benefit from overusing shared resources while costs are spread across everyone
